content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A geologist studying lead concentration in soil selected random samples of soil from two regions: region A and region B. The following histograms show the distribution of lead concentration, in parts per million (<math alttext="p p m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ppm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>), for the two samples. (a) Write a few sentences comparing the distributions of lead concentration in the two samples.(b) To investigate whether the mean lead concentration is different in region A than in region B, the geologist conducted the appropriate test. All conditions for inference are met, and the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of the test is <math alttext="0.007" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.007</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value, is there convincing statistical evidence, at a level of significance of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, that there is a difference between the mean lead concentration of region A and the mean lead concentration of region B? Justify your answer.

Justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.6: Describing the Distribution of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
